title: Special Political and Decolonization Committee
text:
United Nations 
A/C.4/80/L.1
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: Limited 
12 September 2025 
Original: English 
 
25-14603 (E)    190925 
*2514603* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
Special Political and Decolonization Committee 
(Fourth Committee) 
 
 
 
 
 Organization of work 
 
 
 
 Note by the Chair 
 
 
1. 
The agenda items allocated by the General Assembly to the Special Political and 
Decolonization Committee (Fourth Committee) for consideration are listed in 
document A/C.4/80/1. Background information on those items, including references 
to related documentation, is set out in the annotated preliminary list of items to be 
included in the provisional agenda of the eightieth session (A/80/100 and 
A/80/100/Add.1).1 
2. 
The General Assembly, in rule 99, paragraph (b), of its rules of procedure, calls 
upon each Main Committee to adopt a programme of work indicating, if possible, a 
target date for the conclusion of its work, the approximate dates of consideration of 
items and the number of meetings to be allocated for the consideration of each item .  
3. 
The General Assembly decided that the eightieth session should recess on 
Monday, 8 December 2025, and that, inter alia, the Special Political and Decolonization 
Committee (Fourth Committee) should complete its work by Wednesday, 19 November 
2025 (see A/80/250, para. 5 (a) and (b)).  
4. 
To that end, the Special Political and Decolonization Committee (Fourth 
Committee) may wish to consider adopting as a provisional guideline the approximate 
dates set out below for the consideration of the items on its agenda, with the 
understanding that they may be revised periodically, as appropriate. The Committee 
will also consider certain items on its agenda jointly in order to ensure the full and 
efficient utilization of the conference facilities allocated to it. As indicated below, the 
conference services have allocated 28 meetings to the Committee and have urged the 
Committee to make every effort to complete its work within the time allotted. Should 
the Committee wish to change the dates on which it considers items, it would still 
have to work within the dates and times indicated below. 
 
 
__________________ 
 
1  For the final list of agenda items adopted by the General Assembly, see A/80/251.

5. 
In the preparation of the timetable above, the Chair was guided by the following 
considerations:  
 
(a) 
In accordance with established procedures and practices and bearing in 
mind the availability of documentation, the Committee may wish to hold one joint 
general debate covering agenda items 54 to 58 and individual debates on agenda 
items 46 to 53, 59, 121 and 137, on the understanding that draft resolutions and/or 
decisions will be considered separately;  
 
(b) 
Representatives of Non-Self-Governing Territories and petitioners will be 
heard as early as possible during the Committee’s consideration of the related items, 
and the Chair suggests that the Committee devote its meetings from Tuesday, 
7 October to Monday, 13 October, to the hearing of petitioners;  
 
(c) 
Item 121, Revitalization of the work of the General Assembly, is allocated 
to all the Main Committees for the sole purpose of considering and taking action on 
their respective tentative programme of work;  

A/C.4/80/L.1 
 
25-14603
8/8 
 
 
(d) 
Item 137, Programme planning, is allocated to all the Main Committees 
and the plenary of the General Assembly to enhance the discussion of evaluation, 
planning, budgeting and monitoring reports. If the Assembly allocates any report 
submitted under this item to the Fourth Committee, the Committee shall revert to this 
item.  
6. 
Subject to the provisional programme of work above being acceptable to the 
Committee and in order to facilitate its work, the Chair wishes to suggest that the list 
of speakers in the general debate for the respective agenda items be closed as 
indicated in the timetable above.  
7. 
The Chair also wishes to draw the attention of members of the Committee to the 
decisions of the General Assembly on the organization of its work contained in 
document A/80/250, sections II.B to III.  
8. 
Members are also requested to bear in mind the decision of the General 
Assembly that morning and afternoon meetings should start promptly at 10 a.m. and 
3 p.m., respectively, both for plenary meetings and for meetings of the Main 
Committees during the eightieth session. The attention of the members is also drawn 
to the decision of the Assembly to waive, at its eightieth session, the quorum required, 
under rule 108 of the rules of procedure of the General Assembly, for the Chair to 
declare a meeting open and permit the debate to proceed (see A/80/250, para. 8).  
9. 
In view of the limited number of meetings available to the Committee, it is 
suggested that the time limit for statements be set at 10 minutes, with the exception 
of statements made by the spokespersons of groups of delegations, which would be 
extended to 15 minutes. In this connection, the Chair will set the time limit for the 
petitioners as deemed necessary.  
10. The list of documents submitted under the various agenda items allocated to the 
Special Political and Decolonization Committee (Fourth Committee) is contained in 
document A/C.4/80/INF.1, which will be updated as necessary.

paragraphs.1: The agenda items allocated by the General Assembly to the Special Political and Decolonization Committee (Fourth Committee) for consideration are listed in document A/C.4/80/1. Background information on those items, including references to related documentation, is set out in the annotated preliminary list of items to be included in the provisional agenda of the eightieth session (A/80/100 and A/80/100/Add.1).1
paragraphs.2: The General Assembly, in rule 99, paragraph (b), of its rules of procedure, calls upon each Main Committee to adopt a programme of work indicating, if possible, a target date for the conclusion of its work, the approximate dates of consideration of items and the number of meetings to be allocated for the consideration of each item .
paragraphs.3: The General Assembly decided that the eightieth session should recess on Monday, 8 December 2025, and that, inter alia, the Special Political and Decolonization Committee (Fourth Committee) should complete its work by Wednesday, 19 November 2025 (see A/80/250, para. 5 (a) and (b)).
paragraphs.4: To that end, the Special Political and Decolonization Committee (Fourth Committee) may wish to consider adopting as a provisional guideline the approximate dates set out below for the consideration of the items on its agenda, with the understanding that they may be revised periodically, as appropriate. The Committee will also consider certain items on its agenda jointly in order to ensure the full and efficient utilization of the conference facilities allocated to it. As indicated below, the conference services have allocated 28 meetings to the Committee and have urged the Committee to make every effort to complete its work within the time allotted. paragraphs.5: In the preparation of the timetable above, the Chair was guided by the following considerations: (a) In accordance with established procedures and practices and bearing in mind the availability of documentation, the Committee may wish to hold one joint general debate covering agenda items 54 to 58 and individual debates on agenda items 46 to 53, 59, 121 and 137, on the understanding that draft resolutions and/or decisions will be considered separately; (b) Representatives of Non-Self-Governing Territories and petitioners will be heard as early as possible during the Committee’s consideration of the related items, and the Chair suggests that the Committee devote its meetings from Tuesday, 7 October to Monday, 13 October, to the hearing of petitioners; (c) Item 121, Revitalization of the work of the General Assembly, is allocated to all the Main Committees for the sole purpose of considering and taking action on their respective tentative programme of work; A/C.4/80/L.1 25-14603 8/8 (d) Item 137, Programme planning, is allocated to all the Main Committees and the plenary of the General Assembly to enhance the discussion of evaluation, planning, budgeting and monitoring reports. If the Assembly allocates any report submitted under this item to the Fourth Committee, the Committee shall revert to this item.
paragraphs.6: Subject to the provisional programme of work above being acceptable to the Committee and in order to facilitate its work, the Chair wishes to suggest that the list of speakers in the general debate for the respective agenda items be closed as indicated in the timetable above.
paragraphs.7: The Chair also wishes to draw the attention of members of the Committee to the decisions of the General Assembly on the organization of its work contained in document A/80/250, sections II.B to III.
paragraphs.8: Members are also requested to bear in mind the decision of the General Assembly that morning and afternoon meetings should start promptly at 10 a.m. and 3 p.m., respectively, both for plenary meetings and for meetings of the Main Committees during the eightieth session. The attention of the members is also drawn to the decision of the Assembly to waive, at its eightieth session, the quorum required, under rule 108 of the rules of procedure of the General Assembly, for the Chair to declare a meeting open and permit the debate to proceed (see A/80/250, para. 8).
paragraphs.9: In view of the limited number of meetings available to the Committee, it is suggested that the time limit for statements be set at 10 minutes, with the exception of statements made by the spokespersons of groups of delegations, which would be extended to 15 minutes. In this connection, the Chair will set the time limit for the petitioners as deemed necessary.
paragraphs.10: The list of documents submitted under the various agenda items allocated to the Special Political and Decolonization Committee (Fourth Committee) is contained in document A/C.4/80/INF.1, which will be updated as necessary.
